body_html:
Thanks for your response. This must have been am old issue as I have installed Tensorflow without any difficulty on this laptop (Windows 10) and on my Ubuntu 16.04 desktop both of which have Anaconda 3 installed. Installing Tensorflow on either running either of the two commands in terminal : 1) conda install tensorflow or 2) pip install tensorflow. so it seems that Tensorflow is now readily available to all Clive
…
On Sun, Nov 12, 2017 at 7:51 PM, abaviska ***@***.***> wrote: Hi Clived2, Thanks for your comments and reply. What I observed that , if I read my error, it is missing Wheel package in my local libraries. Due to proxy issues, my machine not able to download required packages for installation from Internet. As a workaround, what I did is based on error kept downloading and locally installing number of library packages and finally could install Tensorflow. Atleast 20 different packages needed to supply. If someone has similar proxy issues. Happy to help. Thanks & Regards. — You are receiving this because you commented. Thanks for your  response. This must have been am old issue as I have
installed Tensorflow without any difficulty on this laptop (Windows 10) and
on my Ubuntu 16.04 desktop both of which have Anaconda 3 installed.
Installing Tensorflow on either running either of the two commands in
terminal :
1) conda install tensorflow
or
2) pip install tensorflow.

so it seems that Tensorflow is now readily available to all

Clive

 Hi Clived2, Thanks for your comments and reply.

 What I observed that , if I read my error, it is missing Wheel package in
 my local libraries. Due to proxy issues, my machine not able to download
 required packages for installation from Internet.

 As a workaround, what I did is based on error kept downloading and locally
 installing number of library packages and finally could install Tensorflow.
 Atleast 20 different packages needed to supply. If someone has similar
 proxy issues. Happy to help.

 Thanks & Regards.

body:
Thanks for your  response. This must have been am old issue as I have
installed Tensorflow without any difficulty on this laptop (Windows 10) and
on my Ubuntu 16.04 desktop both of which have Anaconda 3 installed.
Installing Tensorflow on either running either of the two commands in
terminal :
1) conda install tensorflow
or
2) pip install tensorflow.

so it seems that Tensorflow is now readily available to all

Clive



On Sun, Nov 12, 2017 at 7:51 PM, abaviska <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hi Clived2, Thanks for your comments and reply.
>
> What I observed that , if I read my error, it is missing Wheel package in
> my local libraries. Due to proxy issues, my machine not able to download
> required packages for installation from Internet.
>
> As a workaround, what I did is based on error kept downloading and locally
> installing number of library packages and finally could install Tensorflow.
> Atleast 20 different packages needed to supply. If someone has similar
> proxy issues. Happy to help.
>
> Thanks & Regards.
>
